intro: Bernoullia, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue and purple. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are often found in mountainous regions. Bernoullia species are generally herbaceous, with some species exhibiting a semi-shrub form.
